solution_line_template: He wants to run {previous_miles_per_week}*{increase_percentage}=<<{previous_miles_per_week}*{increase_percentage}={miles_increase}>>{miles_increase} miles more than he used to
So he needs to run {previous_miles_per_week}+{miles_increase}=<<{previous_miles_per_week}+{miles_increase}={target_miles_per_week}>>{target_miles_per_week} miles
He is doing this in {total_days}/{days_per_week}=<<{total_days}/{days_per_week}={total_weeks}>>{total_weeks} weeks
So he needs to add {target_miles_per_week}/{total_weeks}=<<{target_miles_per_week}/{total_weeks}={miles_to_add_per_week}>>{miles_to_add_per_week} miles per week
